Title: EPIC-ANA-001: Initial Schema and Configuration Implementation
Description: Establish the foundational, human-readable configuration and schema files that define the analytics data contracts and service policies. This includes YAML for service configuration and JSON for event/property schemas, along with the critical privacy compliance map.
Comments: This epic lays the groundwork for all analytics collection.

Title: US-001: Define Analytics Service Configuration
Description:
As a Data Analyst, I want a single source of truth for the analytics service configuration, so that I understand the data retention, export, and consent policies.

**Acceptance Criteria:**
1. The `config/analytics_configuration.yaml` file exists and contains `data_retention` and `bigquery_export` sections as specified in the SDS.
2. The file contains the `default_consent_settings` section with correct region and storage state mappings.
3. The file contains the `child_directed_treatment` policy description.
Epic: EPIC-ANA-001: Initial Schema and Configuration Implementation

Title: TASK-ANA-001: Create and populate analytics_configuration.yaml
Description: Create the `config/analytics_configuration.yaml` file and meticulously transcribe all specified sections (`data_retention`, `bigquery_export`, `default_consent_settings`, `child_directed_treatment`) from the SDS. Mark the `project_id` as a placeholder.
Epic: EPIC-ANA-001: Initial Schema and Configuration Implementation

Title: TASK-ANA-002: Peer review analytics_configuration.yaml
Description: Conduct a peer review of the `analytics_configuration.yaml` file to verify its correctness against the SDS. This ensures a second pair of eyes catches any typos or transcription errors.
Epic: EPIC-ANA-001: Initial Schema and Configuration Implementation

Title: US-002: Define Custom Event Schemas
Description:
As a Developer, I want a strict data contract for all custom analytics events, so that I can implement tracking in the game client with confidence that the data will be valid.

**Acceptance Criteria:**
1. The `schemas/custom_events.json` file is a valid JSON array.
2. It contains complete and accurate definitions for all 8 specified events.
3. Each parameter's `paramName`, `dataType`, and `description` precisely matches the SDS.
Epic: EPIC-ANA-001: Initial Schema and Configuration Implementation

Title: TASK-ANA-003: Create and populate custom_events.json
Description: Create `schemas/custom_events.json` and populate it with the JSON array defining all 8 game events (`level_start`, `level_complete`, etc.) and their parameters as specified in the SDS.
Epic: EPIC-ANA-001: Initial Schema and Configuration Implementation

Title: TASK-ANA-004: Peer review custom_events.json
Description: Conduct a thorough peer review of `custom_events.json`. The reviewer, ideally from both the client and data teams, must verify that every event, parameter, data type, and description matches the SDS.
Epic: EPIC-ANA-001: Initial Schema and Configuration Implementation

Title: US-003: Define User Property Schemas
Description:
As a Data Analyst, I want a defined schema for user-level properties, so that I can create meaningful user segments for cohort analysis and targeted reporting.

**Acceptance Criteria:**
1. The `schemas/user_properties.json` file is a valid JSON array.
2. It contains complete and accurate definitions for all 5 specified user properties.
3. Each property's `propertyName`, `dataType`, and `description` precisely matches the SDS.
Epic: EPIC-ANA-001: Initial Schema and Configuration Implementation

Title: TASK-ANA-005: Create and populate user_properties.json
Description: Create `schemas/user_properties.json` and populate it with the JSON array defining all 5 user properties (`player_first_open_date`, etc.) and their attributes as specified in the SDS.
Epic: EPIC-ANA-001: Initial Schema and Configuration Implementation

Title: TASK-ANA-006: Peer review user_properties.json
Description: Conduct a peer review of `user_properties.json` to verify correctness against the SDS.
Epic: EPIC-ANA-001: Initial Schema and Configuration Implementation

Title: US-004: Define Privacy Compliance Rules for Data Points
Description:
As a Compliance Officer, I want an auditable map that explicitly links every data point to a privacy rule, so that I can verify that our data collection adheres to regulations like GDPR and COPPA.

**Acceptance Criteria:**
1. The `schemas/privacy_compliance_map.json` file exists and contains `compliance_actions`, `parameter_map`, and `user_property_map` keys.
2. The `parameter_map` contains an entry for every parameter from `custom_events.json`.
3. The `user_property_map` contains an entry for every property from `user_properties.json`.
Epic: EPIC-ANA-001: Initial Schema and Configuration Implementation

Title: TASK-ANA-007: Create and populate privacy_compliance_map.json
Description: Create `schemas/privacy_compliance_map.json`. Populate the `compliance_actions` section. Then, meticulously iterate through every parameter in `custom_events.json` and every property in `user_properties.json` and add a corresponding entry to `parameter_map` and `user_property_map` with the correct compliance action from the SDS.
Epic: EPIC-ANA-001: Initial Schema and Configuration Implementation

Title: TASK-ANA-008: Peer review privacy_compliance_map.json
Description: Conduct an extremely detailed peer review of the compliance map. The reviewer must check that every single parameter and property is present and correctly mapped, as this is a critical compliance artifact.
Epic: EPIC-ANA-001: Initial Schema and Configuration Implementation

Title: EPIC-ANA-002: Repository Governance and Automation
Description: Implement CI/CD automation and documentation to ensure the long-term quality, consistency, and maintainability of the data contracts. This includes automated linting, advanced cross-schema validation, and comprehensive contributor guides.
Comments: This epic makes the repository robust and scalable.

Title: US-005: Implement Automated Linting for Config Files
Description:
As a member of the Development Team, I want to automatically validate the basic syntax of all configuration files on every change, so that malformed files are prevented from being merged and breaking our data contracts.

**Acceptance Criteria:**
1. A CI workflow is triggered on pull requests changing YAML or JSON files.
2. The workflow fails and blocks the merge if a file has a syntax error.
3. The workflow passes if all files are syntactically correct.

Title: TASK-ANA-009: Research and select linters for CI
Description: Investigate, select, and document the best-suited, community-supported linters for YAML and JSON to be used within a GitHub Actions workflow.

Title: TASK-ANA-010: Implement CI workflow for YAML/JSON linting
Description: Create a new GitHub Actions workflow file (`.github/workflows/validation.yml`) that triggers on pull requests. Configure jobs within this workflow to use the selected linters to check all `.yaml` and `.json` files.

Title: TASK-ANA-011: Test linting workflow with invalid files
Description: Create a test pull request containing a deliberately malformed YAML file and a malformed JSON file to verify that the CI workflow fails as expected and blocks the merge.

Title: US-006: Implement Automated Cross-Schema Consistency Checks
Description:
As a member of the Data Team, I want to automatically verify that all defined data points have a corresponding privacy rule, so that we prevent accidental omission of privacy controls and ensure continuous compliance.

**Acceptance Criteria:**
1. The CI pipeline executes a custom validation script after linting.
2. The build fails with a clear error if an event parameter is added but is missing from the privacy map.
3. The build fails if a parameter exists in the privacy map but not in the schema files.

Title: TASK-ANA-012: Design and write core logic for consistency script
Description: Write a Python script (`scripts/validator.py`) that implements the core validation logic. The script must: 1. Parse `custom_events.json`, `user_properties.json`, and `privacy_compliance_map.json`. 2. Extract all parameter names from events and all property names. 3. Extract all mapped keys from the privacy map. 4. Compare the sets and identify discrepancies. 5. Print clear error messages and exit with a non-zero status code.
Comments: Depends on the final, reviewed schemas from Sprint 1.

Title: TASK-ANA-013: Write unit tests for the validation script
Description: To mitigate the risk of a buggy validator, create unit tests for `scripts/validator.py` using a framework like pytest. Test cases should cover: a perfectly consistent state, a parameter missing from the map, a property missing from the map, a parameter in the map but not in the schema, and an empty file scenario.
Comments: This task is a direct mitigation for RISK-AC-003.

Title: TASK-ANA-014: Integrate consistency script into CI pipeline
Description: Modify the `validation.yml` workflow to add a new job that runs after the linters. This job will set up a Python environment, install any dependencies, and execute the `validator.py` script. The build must fail if the script exits with a non-zero code.

Title: TASK-ANA-015: End-to-end test of consistency check in CI
Description: Create a test Pull Request that introduces a deliberate inconsistency (e.g., add a new parameter to `custom_events.json` but not to the map). Verify that the CI pipeline runs and fails specifically at the consistency check step with a clear error message.

Title: US-007: Create Comprehensive Repository README
Description:
As a New Contributor, I want to quickly understand the purpose and structure of the analytics repository by reading a single document, so that I can contribute effectively with minimal ramp-up time.

**Acceptance Criteria:**
1. The README explains the repository's purpose.
2. It describes the role of each of the four primary config/schema files.
3. It provides a high-level overview of the change management process.

Title: TASK-ANA-016: Draft content for README.md
Description: Write the initial draft of the `README.md` file. The content must cover the repository's purpose, a breakdown of each key directory (`config/`, `schemas/`) and file, and a brief summary of the contribution workflow.

Title: TASK-ANA-017: Review and refine README.md
Description: Have at least one other team member review the `README.md` draft for clarity, correctness, and completeness. Incorporate feedback and finalize the document.

Title: US-008: Establish a Formal Contribution Process
Description:
As a Contributor, I want a formal, documented process for making changes to data contracts, so that all changes are consistent, well-vetted, and approved by the correct stakeholders.

**Acceptance Criteria:**
1. `CONTRIBUTING.md` provides a step-by-step guide for the PR process.
2. It defines the roles required for review (e.g., client dev, data analyst).
3. It states the definition of 'done' for a change to be merged.

Title: TASK-ANA-018: Draft content for CONTRIBUTING.md
Description: Write the `CONTRIBUTING.md` file, detailing the precise steps for proposing a change. This includes branch naming conventions, PR template usage, the mandatory requirement for all CI checks to pass, and the explicit definition of required reviewers for different types of changes.

Title: TASK-ANA-019: Review and get sign-off on CONTRIBUTING.md
Description: Circulate the `CONTRIBUTING.md` draft among key stakeholders (e.g., dev lead, data lead, QA lead) to get feedback and formal sign-off. This ensures the defined process is agreed upon by all parties.
